Posts.Content: MED wrote: Hello, Hoping someone can help. Recently had an extensive lumpectomy with clear magins but 1 positive node out of 17. Is there anyone who has had 1 positive node but did not have chemo only radiation?? MED Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Positive node but no chemo MED swimangel72

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 02:58AM MED wrote: Hi SeeBee, Thank you for your reply it sounds like I am in a similiar situation with an OnkoDx score of 18. My Oncologist is also active in doing research. I do have faith in him and he definately looks at the whole picture but I guess I am old school where cancer = chemo. My oncologist told me the exact same thing about using chemotherapy in the past. I definately feel better after reading your blog. Did you have a positive node with your diagnosis or were the nodes all negative?? Happy Friday MED
Posts.Title: oncotype DX test MED lynninpa

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 07:12AM MED wrote: Hi Kathy, In my case they removed 17 nodes and 1 was positive. They did not suggest chemo for me based on my OnxoDx score of 18. The onc said it would be of no benefit to me. This is a test that came out I think about 5 years ago. It looks at your individual tissue for analysis and can determine if chemo will be of any benefit based on the score. Take Care and Best Wishes MED
Posts.Title: oncotype DX test MED lynninpa

Posts.Content: MED wrote: Hello, I hope someone can help me I am so confused. I was recently diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma. Had an extensive lumpectomy with clear margins and 1positive node out of 17 that were removed. Had the oncotype DX test done with a recurrence score of 18. My oncologist said chemotherapy would be of no benefit to me so I have started on Tamoxifen and am scheduled to start radiation tomorrow. I am worried about the 1 positive node and no chemo. Is there anyone who had positive nodes and did not do chemo?? MED Hello, According to my pathology report after surgery my tuor was 0.9cm, Grade 1, Estrogen and Progesterone positive and HER-2 equivical. Thanks to everyone for their input MED Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: oncotype DX test MED lynninpa

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 05:08AM MED wrote: Hi Jule, Thanks for the input.. I would LOVE to hear from someone who was 1 node positive and opted out of chemo. When I got my Onco DX test back according to the graph it showed chemo would be of no benefit to me but I can't help but think there are little "bad" cells floating around inside of me. Needless to say I am driving myself and everyone else nuts. There more I read the more anxious and confused I get. My husband and I are both in the medical field but I'm not sure that is a good thing. Thanky You and Happy Thursday!!
